ui::​VerticalLayout

the vertical layout is used for packing widgets vertically (top to bottom). it implements only 3 functions: pack_start, pack_end and pack_center

Functions
VerticalLayout
VerticalLayout(
int x,
y,
w,
h,
Scene s
): AutoLayout(x,y,w,h,s):

parameters:

y

y coord of the layout's top left corner

x

x coord of the layout's top right corner

w

width of the layout

h

height of the layout

s

the scene that the layout is adding widgets to

pack_start
void pack_start(
Widget *w,
int padding= 0
):

put this widget at the start of the layout

pack_end
void pack_end(
Widget *w,
int padding= 0
):

put this widget at the end of the layout

pack_center
void pack_center(
Widget *w
):

put this widget at the center of the layout

ui::​HorizontalLayout

the horizontal layout is used for packing widgets horizontally (left to right). it implements only 3 functions: pack_start, pack_end and pack_center

Functions
HorizontalLayout
HorizontalLayout(
int x,
y,
w,
h,
Scene s
): AutoLayout(x,y,w,h,s):

parameters:

y

y coord of the layout's top left corner

x

x coord of the layout's top right corner

w

width of the layout

h

height of the layout

s

the scene that the layout is adding widgets to

pack_start
void pack_start(
Widget *w,
int padding= 0
):

put this widget at the start of the layout

pack_end
void pack_end(
Widget *w,
int padding= 0
):

put this widget at the end of the layout

pack_center
void pack_center(
Widget *w
):

put this widget in the center of the layout
